name: Big Ben
description: 16-storey Gothic clocktower and national symbol at the Eastern end of the Houses of Parliament.

name: London Eye
description: Huge observation wheel giving passengers a privileged bird's-eye view of the city's landmarks.

name: British Museum
description: Huge showcase for global antiquities, including Egyptian mummies and ancient Greek sculptures.

name: Buckingham Palace
tagline: Home of the British Queen & State Rooms
description: Visitors can tour the palace's opulent private and state rooms or watch the changing of the guard.

name: River Thames
description: The River Thames is a river that flows through southern England, most notably through London. At 215 miles, it is the longest river entirely in England and the second longest in the United Kingdom

name: Tower Bridge
description: Panoramic views from high level walkways and behind-the-scenes access to original lifting machinery.

name: Hyde Park
tagline: Acres of greenery in Central London
description: Huge green space, home to Diana Memorial Fountain, with boating and swimming in the Serpentine lake.

name: St Paul's Cathedral
description: Churchyard and gardens outside Saint Paul's cathedral, with a floor-plan of the original building.

name: Trafalgar Square
description: Nelson's Column rises above this iconic square's LED-lit fountains, artworks and lion statues.

name: Palace of Westminster
description: Neo-Gothic masterpiece and seat of the UK government. Guided tours on Saturdays and in summer.

name: Covent Garden
description: Covent Garden is in the West End, London’s main theatre and entertainment area. Tourists fill its elegant, car-free Piazza, home to fashion stores, crafts at the Apple Market and the Royal Opera

name: Westminster Abbey
description: Protestant abbey hosting daily services and every English and British coronation since 1066.

name: London Bridge
description: Concrete pedestrian and traffic bridge that gave a major railway station its name.

name: National Gallery, London
description: Trafalgar Square art museum whose masterworks trace the development of Western European painting.

name: Piccadilly Circus
description: Buzzing Theatre-district square with giant neon signs & the 19th-c. Shaftesbury Memorial Fountain.

name: Soho
tagline: Buzzy area for West End theatre & dining
description: The energetic streets of Soho, in the West End, feature an eclectic mix of dining, nightlife and shopping options. Dean, Frith, Beak and Old Compton streets are the epicentre of activity day

name: The Shard
description: 87-floor glass skyscraper with a jagged peak, with restaurants, offices, hotel and viewing platform.

name: Oxford Street
description: Oxford Street is a major road in the City of Westminster in the West End of London, running from Tottenham Court Road to Marble Arch via Oxford Circus. It is Europe's busiest shopping street,

name: Victoria and Albert Museum
description: Blockbuster exhibitions and permanent decorative arts collection, with design shop and ornate cafe.

name: Natural History Museum, London
description: Landmark museum of animals and natural phenomena, with hands-on exhibits and animatronic dinosaurs.

name: Kensington Palace
description: Royal palace and gardens, with exhibits on former residents like Queen Victoria and Princess Diana.

name: Camden Town
description: Camden Town is famed for its market, a warren of fashion and curiosities by the Regent’s Canal. A haven of counter culture, the area is popular with tourists, teenagers and punks. The thriving

name: Regent's Park
tagline: Cafe & sport centre with changing rooms
description: Modern, glass-clad cafe and sports administrative centre, with pitches and changing rooms.

name: Tate Modern, London
tagline: Contemporary art & cafe with river views
description: Modern-art gallery with international works on display, plus a cafe with panoramic river views.

name: London King's Cross railway station
description: First opened in 1852, this restored train station is a busy hub associated with Harry Potter books.

name: Borough Market
description: Huge market under the railway lines, for British-reared meat and artisanal baked and dairy goods.

name: South Bank
description: Right beside the River Thames, the South Bank is a dynamic area at the heart of London’s cultural scene. The Southbank Centre, National Theatre and BFI film theatre are all world-class arts venues

name: St James's Park
tagline: Royal park hosting Trooping the Colour
description: Green space with a lake with daily pelican feeding, a grass-roofed cafe and ceremonial displays.

name: Notting Hill
description: Notting Hill is a vibrant, trendy area. Casual cafes line bohemian Portobello Road, famed for its busy market selling antiques and vintage fashion. Filmgoers relax in posh armchairs at the Electric

name: London Zoo
description: Major city zoo and research centre helping to conserve numerous species in naturalistic habitats.

name: Shakespeare's Globe
description: Oak-and-thatch replica of original Elizabethan theatre, showing Shakespeare plays in the open air.

name: Kensington Gardens
tagline: Green expanse west of Hyde Park
description: Expansive park containing Kensington Palace and the Diana, Princess of Wales Memorial Playground.

name: Portobello Road
description: Portobello Road is a street in the Notting Hill district of the Royal Borough of Kensington and Chelsea in west London. It runs almost the length of Notting Hill from south to north, roughly

name: Millennium Bridge, London
description: Elegant steel suspension footbridge crossing the Thames from the Tate Modern to St Paul's Cathedral.

name: Hampton Court Palace
description: Famous seat of Henry VIII and his many wives, this palace received elegant Stuart-era modernisation.

name: London Dungeon
description: Costumed actors and themed fairground rides depicting macabre stories from London's past.

name: Paddington
description: Paddington blends shiny offices with elegant Georgian townhouses. Paddington station is a busy national rail hub, home to the Heathrow Express. Travellers unwind in hotels near Norfolk Square

name: Leicester Square
description: Leicester Square is a pedestrianised square in the West End of London, England. It was laid out in 1670 and is named after the contemporary Leicester House, itself named after Robert Sidney,

name: Museum of London
tagline: London stories from prehistory to today
description: Artifacts and interactives chronicle London's turbulent history from pre-Roman to modern times.

name: Royal Observatory, Greenwich
tagline: Astronomy centre on the Prime Meridian
description: Wren's 18th-century astronomical observatory on the Prime Meridian, now a museum with a planetarium.

name: The Royal Albert Hall
description: One of Britain's great Victorian splendours, most famous for the Proms classical music festival.

name: Kings Cross, London
description: King’s Cross is a major rail hub, with national trains at King’s Cross station and the Eurostar terminal at St. Pancras. The revitalised Regent's Canal area has offices, landscaped walkways and

name: Brick Lane
tagline: Street art, shopping, fashion, and art
description: Brick Lane is a street in the East End of London, in the Borough of Tower Hamlets. It runs from Swanfield Street in Bethnal Green, crosses Bethnal Green Road in Shoreditch, passes through Spitalfields

name: Camden Market
tagline: Stalls & shops with an alternative bias
description: Eclectic market with youthful vibe and stalls/shops selling fashion and accessories, music and more.

name: Royal Botanic Gardens, Kew
tagline: Plants from the Arctic to the Tropics
description: Trees and flowers from around the globe in vast gardens with huge greenhouses and Treetop Walkway.

name: Madame Tussauds London
description: Museum chain for life-size wax replicas of famous celebrities & historic icons in themed galleries.

name: Science Museum, London
tagline: Hands-on exhibits in dozens of galleries
description: A vast treasury of science and invention, famous for its state-of-the-art interactive exhibits.

name: Westminster Bridge
description: Arched Victorian road bridge, with pavements

name: Sea Life London Aquarium
description: The Sea Life London Aquarium is located on the ground floor of County Hall on the South Bank of the River Thames in central London, near the London Eye. It opened in March 1997 as the London

name: Monument to the Great Fire of London
description: Sir Christopher Wren-designed column commemorating London's Great Fire, with a viewing platform.
